cSNmk730o0w8gPYlQ_tOWw.text: This is my favourite Mexican Food stop in Singapore. Located in Holland Village, it's a just short walk from Holland Hills. Always a busy place, but reservations for two is not a must on a Sunday evening, so great for a spontaneous visit. To me, this is important because I favour being able to choose my dinner by actual mood and craving - I am definitely not a fan of planning days or hours ahead. My husband and me loooooooove the great tacos, burritos, guacamole and of course the margaritas here. All is super fresh and very very tasty.Staff is nice and attentive, I like them colourful tablecloths and decorations, chairs are comfy and seating is not too close - just perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of El Patio Mexican Restaurant & Wine Bar - Singapore, Singapore. El Patio, this lovely Sunday evening.

5uZfPHRL-owScUjfqlvUrw.text: Beef enchiladas ($18++ = $21.19) - 3.5 starsA tad bit salty but the flavor was alright, although I think I'm generally getting desperate and my standards have dropped. Not as good as Belmonte flavor-wise, but I appreciated the side cucumber and radish salad and the refried beans. Made for a more well-rounded meal as opposed to a straight up meat and rice burrito. It's pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of El Patio Mexican Restaurant & Wine Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Beef enchiladas ($18)

kDqbLFoza59bdmcYYx3A7g.text: I had a sangria (soso) and a shrimp burrito here for dinner on a Wednesday night. Salsa and chips come free.My burrito was large and freshly made, and it was average, which is to be expected from a place in Holland Village. I am not an expert on Mexican food, nor Tex-Mex in general, but the flavors here are nothing to shout about.Service here is good and prompt, and they gave me a holder for my handbag.

photos.caption: Photo of El Patio Mexican Restaurant & Wine Bar - Singapore, Singapore. White sangria.
Photo of El Patio Mexican Restaurant & Wine Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Shrimp burrito.

taR9CPbE5foRUDi_S14V4A.text: After reading not so great reviews I was skeptical to come here. But I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good, but I do agree with other reviewers that it lacks so spice. And the prices were good too. Standard Singapore prices...so kind of expensive compared to other places in Asian. Overall I would probably come back here (especially for the free chips and salsa) but I'm still on the hunt for the best Mexican place in Singapore

AooGLD6oxbl8gEealmyMkg.text: I don't know why it took me so long to find this place! There's always plenty of seats and I love the authentic ambiance that is not pretentious at all. As pretty much everyone else said, this place is legit. I always get my steak burrito here with A LOT OF guac on the side. I love the guac so much by the way. Each portion that is meant for one person is very generous for Singapore standard so that's totally a plus, I even share it with someone every time I visit. They give plenty of meats and they are really flavorful & tender. The food is always fresh, not microwaved. Prices are a little expensive but I guess still quite acceptable considering the portion size, location and quality of the food. Customer service is AWESOME; staffs are efficient. Also free chips and salsa is always good while you wait for the food to be ready. Hence, my 1 extra star for quick service, free chips and salsa! I'll be back to try more things!

c_0Hr71gX-bQquqJ9F3_pw.text: This is a nice option among the busy celebration street in Holland Village. If you arrive before 7, it is pretty empty and easy to get a good spot. They serve a variety of Mexican food and drinks. I tried the sizzling fajita platter. The beef was cooked well and marinated nicely. The tortillas and condiments were nothing special - not particularly fresh or prepared beyond initial purchase. This is a rare Mexican restaurant in Singapore that actually serves complimentary chips and salsa, which is a proper requirement for all Mexican restaurants in the US at least. The chips are nice and thin, while the salsa is good as well. For drinks, you can get margaritas by the glass or jug, as well as many other choices. Overall, this is a good choice for eating in Holland Village, as well as drinking, while most other bars only focus on the latter.

photos.caption: Photo of El Patio Mexican Restaurant & Wine Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Fajitas
Photo of El Patio Mexican Restaurant & Wine Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Fajitas sides

38EFKj_-cDj1pV357NcLLw.text: Having lived in NY for many years and also vacationing to Mexico perhaps we are spoiled by proper Mexican food. We had the fish tacos, guacamole and chicken enchiladas everything lacked spice, and not enough cilantro. Probably the worst Mexican food we've ever experienced. Very expensive too!

y12Bric3eINC2ruPxPoQqg.text: I know, it's always less full than the Mexican restaurant next door, but like so often, this is not indicative or what you get, because, having had lunch at either place many times, el patio clearly wins the Holland Village Mexican showdown. Free chips & salsa, attentive staff, more authentic food, and more generous portions, as well as what I personally find a more charming ambiance.Try not to always follow the crowds. The Herds are wrong more often than not. Unless you absolutely can't stand privacy ;)

3PMCWaGYMsrPxYFXV3SI4A.text: Usually our go-to Mexican restaurant in Holland village. Not the best service but the food is fresh and of good quality. A little pricey but the portions are decent sized. Another similar Mexican restaurant next door, but this one is the winner of the two.

_fQJFLudVb1FZrvnkAPB0Q.text: Why you'd open 2 mexican restaurants of very similar quality right next to each other is beyond me.  It was probably some domestic dispute but after giving cha cha cha 2 stars I'd feel inclined to give el patio 3 stars mainly because they have free chips and salsa which makes it not a bad place to grab a drink. I'd say the food is marginally better but that isnt saying much. They wont win any awards but you can get a decent burrito which is slightly over priced.  The nachos are pretty good and well loaded up.  The service is about average.  There are better Mexican places in Singapore but not in Holland Village.

ZkoPCkkIQarvU5fDpTUIPg.text: Pretty disappointed with the food. For $18 for a burrito it came out with beans that definitely look like its canned and not made fresh and side salad that does not make any sense. I had great Mexican food in the Bay area for fraction of the cost. I was not expecting to get that here but I was not expecting it to be this bad and expensive. You only get one round of free nachos and they will charge you for succeeding orders.

TiBchaYlX-qzsVlJamSO7g.text: Really disappointed. Took our two young children there for dinner this evening. It took 45 mins to serve some simple fajitas and quesadillas. The kids were served after the adults and in the end the food was average at best. We won't be back.

SCqfuZf4PZGfTcssXFi4Ww.text: Really bad. Food was so badly prepared that I'd better use $100 we spent there for myself and cook similar badly prepared food at home.Hubby says even beer tasted bad.

B0Euvk_lbL4zaHrBHQoLRg.text: The best margarita in Singapore can be found right here at El Patio. Served in a jam jar, this margarita is perfectly balanced in terms of alcohol proportion. It is not too strong so  you can actually taste the lime or mango depending on the version you choose. The mango one is especially refreshing if you're sitting alfresco in the heat. Mexican food is pretty generic with beans, cheese, guacamole, mice meat wraps etc but I do enjoy the  chimichanga here packed full of guacamole and cheese, its almost like a mexican lasagne!
